Rule 1: Each turn begins with you rolling all 6 dices until a minimum of 300 points is scored.

 Rule 2: After passing 300 points, you may choose to stop and take the points or stay greedy and keep rolling.

 Rule 3: After each roll, a scoring dice must be set aside. If you continue to roll, there are fewer dice and a greater risk of failing to score and losing points.

Rule 4: If no scoring dice are rolled, youÂ´re turn is over and all points accumulated on that turn are lost.

 Rule 5: Scoring dice from different rolls cannot be combined.

 Rule 6: If you get all dices are used to give score you can either save and begin a new turn or choose to throw again to try and get more score. 

Rule 7: Once you passes 10.000 points you have won.

 Dice rolls are scored as follows:
 * Three of a kind of every dice is worth 100 time the value of the dice, except ones which are worth 1 000 points.
 * Single ones are worth 100 and single fives 50 points.
 * Straight is 1 000 points
